unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Good news folks! Maharashtra is getting a serious renewable energy makeover. The state government, in collaboration with IIT Bombay, just announced a massive new solar power initiative targeting remote villages in the Vidarbha region.
normalised: Good news folks! Maharashtra is getting a serious renewable energy makeover. The state government, in collaboration with I I T Bombay, just announced a massive new solar power initiative targeting remote villages in the Vidarbha region.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, the project lead, says this will drastically reduce reliance on expensive and polluting coal-based power. Imagine, clean energy powering homes and businesses!
normalised: Doctor Sharma, the project lead, says this will drastically reduce reliance on expensive and polluting coal-based power. Imagine, clean energy powering homes and businesses!

unnormalised: The plan includes installing solar panels on rooftops covering an area of approximately 50,000 sq ft and setting up community-owned biogas plants. This initiative is projected to save villagers an estimated Rs. 10,000 annually on electricity bills.
normalised: The plan includes installing solar panels on rooftops covering an area of approximately fifty thousand square feet and setting up community-owned biogas plants. This initiative is projected to save villagers an estimated rupee ten thousand annually on electricity bills.

unnormalised: The project aims to provide reliable, 24/7 power within a 5 km radius of each plant. With the sun shining bright over India, this is a great step forward! Let's hope it encourages other states to follow suit and embrace a greener future. Jai Hind!
normalised: The project aims to provide reliable, twenty four seven power within a five kilometer radius of each plant. With the sun shining bright over India, this is a great step forward! Let's hope it encourages other states to follow suit and embrace a greener future. Jai Hind!
